page.title: 08THE RAILWAY AT HARRIETSHAM
page.content: The Maidstone to Ashford rail link crosses the A20 at Harrietsham and the level of the bridge is, and has been causing difficulty for many years. Some years ago the road was lowered to allow better drainage and avoid further flooding. This was reasonably successful but further lowering of the road surface is now required due to the number of large haulage vehicles that find it impossible to pass under it. The line was electrified soon after the second world war and with the gradual introduction of new carriages the service is quite efficient. The replacement of old track with new continuous welded track has reduced the noise level and travelling by train has now become dependable and pleasant.
